title: Major gameplay problems with new 7.7 patch
body:
After downloading the new 7.7 patch I played a game of LoL. I immediately noticed a difference in gameplay - my fps was 20-30 when normally I play with 80-120 fps. I also disconnected from the game 4 times. Prior to this patch I have never disconnected from a game. I was disconnecting from LoL servers but not from the internet. 

The first thing I tried was a complete proper shutdown of my computer and rebooting the household internet. Then I opened up LoLclient while running some security programs. I disconnected from LoL servers while idle in the client lobby after a few minutes. 

Please fix this riot. 

After dling the new patch I
- have significantly lower fps (20-30... which is pretty frustrating)
-disconnect randomly from your servers

I'm going to try again after finishing running my security programs but I'm feeling doubtful.

Thanks,

A

replies.body:
Restarting was a solid step in case something crashed in the background.  Frame drops like this can be common after a patch update, in case a game file has gone bad.  The culprit could be otehr factors too like an outdated driver.  My suggestion would be to go through the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to help tune things up.

If you're disconnecting, then that could be an entirely seperate issue with your network reaching the game server.  If that's still happening then you'll want to go through the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide as well.

Test it in a custom game and let me know.

Porocles. This isnt a 1/10000000 instance, iv read forums here, and reddit. I myself was running near flawlessly 4-5days ago (prior to patch 7.7)  i was doing great in ranked due to no lag for weeks. now since 7.7 im down to 5 - 7 fps in early game and teamfights. game was running liquid smooth before this patch. I really dont want to hear its problems on users ends, because its not. this patch is messing with alot of users from low to high end pcs. i have a 120mbps connection and 12 upload speed. takes me 2 - 3 minutes to load onto the rift. Iv also done driver updates, fresh install of lol, and defraggler.  Any ETA on when you guys will fix your performance issues with this patch?
SAME

I'm also having connection issues that never happened before updating to this patch, tried restarting and trying a new game but still not working. My FPS has never been super high so not worried about that. To see if it was the game or my internet I tried opening the boards on google chrome and it worked even though the game said I was disconnected.. any ideas? :C

You can still have issues like packet loss or an unstable connection when reaching a specific service, like the game server.  You can run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to know for sure.  When you say connection issue, I'm assuming you're referring to in-game.  Should this be the case, you'll also want to go over the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot.  I hope that helps!
Alright, I'm currently doing a client repair to see if anything derped with that, I'll try a log reader if things continue! But uh...What does a log reader _do_? I'm not very tech savvy XD

Sounds good!  The log reader will grab a log from your recent matches, and check the health of your connection during that game.  It will let you know if it detects any problems like high ping, packet loss, etc.  It also offers some troubleshooting steps specific to your case.  This will help us confirm a connection problem!
Can I run the log reader while my client is doing the repair or do I need to wait until its back up?
You can do it right now, a repair shouldn't impact it.  It's just grab a file stored in your directory, just make sure you're on the PC you're playing on because it is stored locally.

I'm afraid that this just isn't true. My friends have dealt with serious fps issues and we all have relatively good builds. I don't have to bad of a disconnection issue and can't comment there but my game has crashed multiple times since the newest update, when my game never crashed before.
This is so frustrating nearly every second game im disconnecting like 3-4 times.

I can't tell if it's in regards to the patch but suddenly I am crashing mid game, sometimes more than once, and it doesn't give a bugsplat message or anything. My game just randomly insta-closes as if it was minimized, but then I have to reconnect. It's so sudden that my character doesn't walk back to base when it happens... very tilting.

I am also having this as well as my ping issue. But this just started. It closes the whole application and you have to relog and reconnect right? And sometimes when a game is starting it crashes immediately and you have to keep clicking reconnect to get in?

Hi Porocles,

I've done a major comp clean-up and optimization but while I'm waiting on my de-frag to finish I thought of another problem I've been experiencing i'd like to ask you about. Every so often... approximately once every 7-10 games... my client will completely freeze in champion select. It might happen during bans or during picks... it's happened before, after, and as I've selected a champion. This is a problem that began to occur after a recent move so it's relative to the new network I've been using... or it might be related to a recent system restore I put my computer through. Either way - I know it's an issue that other people have experienced because I've read about it on other forums but I haven't found any solutions. Could you offer up some starting points for us all?

Thanks,

A

Edit: I've also updated all of my drivers.

This sounds like an unstable connection issue during champion select, and causing hiccups or desyncs.  With a new network as well as the adjustments made to your PC, it's possible that some tuning up may be necessary.  I stand with my suggestion to go over those guides, especially the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to help configure your network and rule out possibilities.  Hope it helps!
